availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George L. Miller (Boone County, Kentucky, farm manager and soldier)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farm manager and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John J. Miller and Maria Miller. Married to Martha Emma Slater Miller in Boone County, Kentucky, on November 22, 1859. Father of John C. Miller. Farm manager in Boone County in 1860. Farmer in Boone County in 1863. Served in the 30th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant from December 15, 1863 to April 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 225A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Union, p. 389.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Big Bone, p. 153A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boone County Marriages, Film #000523725, p. 223.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Boone County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 273 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0399.
Find A Grave, "George L. Miller (1840-1923)," Memorial #16663356, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/16663356 (accessed June 24, 2020).
